reviews.review_msg: No Comments
The best professor I had at SFU. Assignments, midterm and final were very fair. Don't be intimidated if she seems cold, because she is an amazing, caring person and has a great sense of humor.

This course is very straight forward and almost entirely computational. If you are interested in E&M or fluids, or things you learned about in calc 3, this is a good starting point. Kropinski is a great teacher in my opinion, no chip on her shoulder, a sense of humour and a very reasonable MT and final. The assignments were long and grueling though

First impression is she is very severe, but that wears off after a couple of lectures actually quite friendly.  Final is based on the last two weeks of class and was moderately difficult, all exams are fair, but homework can be quite time consuming especially the questions that she adds.

This class was pretty slow up until the end, and the final focused primarily on the material in the last few weeks. She may seem scary but she's very approachable. I recommend this course if you liked 251 and wanted to know why some of the methods in that course worked.

She didn't seem very interested in the course but she taught really well and clear. The pace was kind of slow throughout the semester and it seems like all final exam stuff happened in the last weeks weeks.
not a good teacher at all extremely boring, exams are hardddddddddd, i ran out of time for both the midterms with 3 questions blank be careful

Ralf is one of the greatest prof I 've met at SFU math. I took both Math 251 & 252 with him, and both courses brought great experience to me. The fact that he put a lot of efforts into the course impressed me greatly. Though the homeworks were long, but it's really fun doing it. The final wasn't hard at all and I learned a lot of physics, LOL

Just finished the course with RW and thought I'd share my experience. Ralf is a nice instructor who is enthusiastic and caring. The TA (Chiaka) was also very funny and nice; the two make a great team. Unfortunately, Ralf made the final exam brutally hard and excruciating long. Instead of a test of knowledge, it was a marathon of infinite questions.

11 pages of homework questions for one week is the most I have ever had for any given course. Homework questions cover a broad range of material (out of textbook too).. hard to study for the exam.. Regret taking this course with RW =(

I have already taken this course in UBC, but I am retaking it again to refresh my memory on vector calculus because of my physics program. Compared to UBC, Ralf is going overboard with this course and making it harder than it really needs to be. It was a mistake to retake it because I will probably get a lower grade.

An absolutely superb professor. He teaches so clearly and is sooo helpful. You ask him one question, he give so much useful info. He makes the subject so interesting. You really miss the lectures if you don't go to it!!
Very helpful.  Midterm and final had high averages though they weren't overly easy.  Great at teaching...very enthusiastic...
He is so hot! The only reason why I go to class. He could dress a bit better. So smart!
He is super helpful and he really wants the students to understand the concepts.
He's ok.
Drop the accent buddy... we all know you're from alabama.

shocked to see the ratings were low for Weiran, had her for two classes and shes quite a good professor. Shes concise, she knows what shes doing, doesnt freeze up when a student asks her a question and lots of bonus/chances to improve grade. I would take her for upper div courses for sure

Weiran is very approachable and passionate about the subject. It's a hard course but if you go to office hours and pay attention in class Its very doable. Quizzes are hard but lots of homework and quiz retakes for partial marks.

Weiran is an impressive prof who lectures without notes, unlike most profs, and explains concepts clearly. The course is about 8/10 in difficultyâ€”tough if you struggled with Math 251. Attend every class since notes aren't posted. Quizzes and tutorials can be tricky, so study ahead. Stay on top of things! Overall, goated prof!

shes the human wolfram alpha with logic and doesnt make mistakes like wolfram sometimes does, does the lecture off the top of her head and doesnt miss anything from the textbook. lots of opportunities to get bonus marks, really clear lectures. If you have weiran for math consider that a W.  math 252 in general though is a big workload.

some of the assignments and quizzes can be on the harder side, however you can tell she knows her stuff. She walks in with just chalk and then does the whole divergence theorem, applications, examples, and how it correlates to previous stuff off the top of her head w no errors. Really solid lecturer compared to other math profs

as a lecturer shes really good and any question you ask she has an answer whereas some profs would fumble. She gives lots of opportunity for extra credit and her notes are clear. I would just say the quizzes are on the harder side and the midterms are fair but a tad difficult. DO AS MUCH PRACTICE POSSIBLE

Lacks the ability to relate to how much students understand and where they are at. Exams are extremely unfair and difficult. Expect to be asked random proofs and derivations.  Many times she said something will be/or not on the exam, the opposite was true. Doesnt seem to be interested in your success.

She is not the clearest lecturer on the planet, and her assignments will leave you bewildered. On the other hand, her final exam was a surprisingly reasonable and straightforward affair. She makes courses harder than they really are.
made the course way tooo hard. Speedy lectures, unpredictable midterm questions. recommend not to take her for 252.
Super impossible final.
Cute, smart, and really helpful, though the tests were not easy! Take course with him and enjoy!

Professor Nigam is by far one of my favourite professors I've had so far in my degree. She is definitely passionate about math and that carries over into her teaching. Most of the lectures are spent deriving formulas and going over theory/concepts but there are more examples in her posted notes. Midterm was very fair but marked somewhat harshly

Dr. Brugiapaglia is probably my favorite prof at SFU (so this review is biased). That being said, his lectures are extremely worthwhile attending, homework is fair and often the answer was in the textbook and final was fair. Midterm seemed pretty long. I managed to finish but by the skin of my teeth. Always willing to meet outside of office hours

Honestly he was a great professor to have for calc 252, I had to retake this course because I didn't get a good enough graded the first time around. He never threw curveballs and everything was pretty standard. My only complaint was that it was hard to read his handwriting lol. BUT I felt he was extremely fair and really set us up well for tests:)
